garrett_struggling.speaker: Narrator
garrett_struggling.text: You find Garrett at his table, but today something is different. His hands shake as they grip a worn piece of paper. Tears streak his weathered face.

garrett_crying.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_crying.text: *He doesn't try to hide his tears* Today would have been her birthday. Seventy-eight. We were going to travel. See the ocean. She always wanted to see the ocean.

garrett_regret.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_regret.text: We kept saying 'next year.' There was always a reason to wait. And then there was no more time. No more 'next years.'

garrett_angry.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_angry.text: *His voice rises* I'm angry. Do you know that? Angry at her for leaving. Angry at myself for not taking her to see that damned ocean. Angry that I'm still here and she's not.

garrett_breaks.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_breaks.text: *He puts his head in his hands* Everyone says time heals. Three years. Three years and it still feels like yesterday. How much time do I need?

player_comfort_garrett.speaker: Narrator
player_comfort_garrett.text: Garrett is in deep pain. What do you do?

choices.text: Sit with him in silence, offering presence instead of words.
Maybe healing isn't about forgetting. It's about carrying them differently.
Your dragon gently nuzzles Garrett's hand.

garrett_silence.speaker: Narrator
garrett_silence.text: You sit beside him. Minutes pass. The cafe grows quiet around you. Eventually, his breathing steadies.

garrett_grateful_silence.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_grateful_silence.text: *Finally looking up* Thank you. For not trying to fix it. Some things can't be fixed. They can only be... witnessed.

garrett_considers.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_considers.text: *He looks at you through tears* Carrying them differently? I... I've been trying to hold on so tight. As if loosening my grip means losing her.

garrett_dragon_comfort.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_dragon_comfort.text: *He startles, then laughs through his tears as your dragon nuzzles him* You strange, wonderful creature. Eleanor would have adored you. She always said animals know things we've forgotten.

garrett_realization.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_realization.text: Maybe... maybe holding on isn't the same as honoring her. Maybe I've been so busy missing her that I forgot how to remember her. The real her. The laughing, living her.

garrett_small_step.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_small_step.text: *He looks at the recipe in his hands* She wrote this with such joy. Not so I could mourn over it. So I could... *his voice trails off, but there's something new in his eyes*
